sen.e: However, it is said that the ouomi (minister) still used the old crown
However, it is said that the O-omi continued to used the old caps.

sen.j: 685年（天武14）諸王以上十二階、諸臣四十八階が導入されている。
sen.e: In 685, twelve ranks for persons in the rank higher than shoo, and forty-eight ranks for persons in shoshin were introduced.
In 685, twelve ranks for Princes and above, and forty-eight ranks for high-ranking officials were introduced.

sen.j: 親王や諸王も冠位制の中に組み込んだ。
sen.e: Shinno (prince) and shoo were also fit into the courtly ranks.
Princes with the rank of Shinno and Shoo were also incorporated into the cap rank system.
Princes with the rank of Shinno and Shoo were also incorporated into the cap rank system.

sen.j: 701年（大宝元）に、冠位制は廃止され、律令制太政官に移行している。
sen.e: In 701, the system of courtly ranks was abolished and transferred to the system of Grand Council of the State based on the Ritsuryo codes.
In 701, the cap rank system was abolished and transferred to the Grand Council of the State based on the Ritsuryo codes.

sen.j: 基本となっているのは冠位四十八階であるが、名称を正一位、従三位などとわかりやすく改訂した。
sen.e: In this system, the basis was forty-eight courtly crown ranks, but the rank names were revised to the ones more easier to understand, such as senior grade of the first Court rank and junior grade of the third Court rank in the Court hierarchy.

sen.j: 四十八階を三十階に減らしている。
sen.e: And number of courtly ranks was reduced to thirty from forty-eight.
